# dataStride

**Instance Property**

The number of bytes from a vector to the next one in the data.

## Declaration

```swift
var dataStride: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

You can use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource] parameters can together to interleave data for multiple geometry sources in the same array, improving rendering performance. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometrySource] for details.

## Inspecting a Geometry Source

- **data**: The data for the geometry source.
- **semantic**: The semantic value (or attribute) the geometry source describes for each vertex.
- **vectorCount**: The number of vectors in the data.
- **usesFloatComponents**: A Boolean value that indicates whether vector components are floating-point values.
- **componentsPerVector**: The number of scalar components in each vector.
- **bytesPerComponent**: The size, in bytes, of each vector component.
- **dataOffset**: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the data to the first vector component to be used in the geometry source.
